suncertify.client.gui

Class BrokerSpecPanel.SpecItemListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.client.gui.BrokerSpecPanel.SpecItemListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ItemListener, java.util.EventListener
    Enclosing class:
    BrokerSpecPanel

    private class BrokerSpecPanel.SpecItemListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ItemListener
    The SpecItemListener class implements the ItemListener interface. This is the callback for the selection and deselection in the JCheckBoxes used in displaying the "specialities" attribute.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private SpecItemListener() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent event)
      This method determines which of the JCheckBox items were selected and creates a ", " delimited list of the Strings associated with each item to create a single String.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpecItemListener

        private SpecItemListener()

    • Method Detail

      • itemStateChanged

        public void itemStateChanged(java.awt.event.ItemEvent event)
        This method determines which of the JCheckBox items were selected and creates a ", " delimited list of the Strings associated with each item to create a single String. The created String is then assigned to the "specialities" attribute of the record.
        Specified by:
        itemStateChanged in interface java.awt.event.ItemListener
        Parameters:
        event - This is a reference to an ItemEvent object providing the event data.
